Name: $6.25 Movies
Description: Every Tuesday at Penn Cinema, all standard screenings are only 6.25 dollars, all day long!
Location: Penn Cinema Riverfront and IMAX Theatre

Name: Robert Straight's Trifecta
Description: Trifecta represents the three formats Robert Straight uses in the execution of his work: three-dimensional sculptures, constructed structures, and the more conventional rectangular paintings. Though different in form, the underlying theme of time is present in each piece. A single path of color, a bold line, an irregular shape all convey a journey through time while newspaper collage signifies the day he created each piece...

Name: Maryanne Pollock's Transit
Description: Maryanne Pollock's abstract work finds affinity with the Washington Color School, where the application of pure color creates glowing visual sensations. Her spontaneous and improvisational style explores the effects between nurture and nature through the creative process...

Name: Green By Nature Preschool: Animal Homes
Description: INvestigate how animals find shelter in a marsh habitat. Take a walk, enjoy a snack and make a home of your own. Led by Valerie Walters and Shweta Arya

Name: Spring Equinox Labyrinth Walk
Description: Slow down, settle your mind, and step into the quietude of the Museum’s Labyrinth in the Anthony N. Fusco Reservoir. Although the Labyrinth walk is free, donations are accepted for maintenance of the Museum’s Labyrinth.

Name: Flight Club
Description: The Chelsea Tavern Flight Club in the Underground. What is the club all about? We can't tell you...

Name: Tonic Town Hall Tuesday with Ken Simpler
Description: Tonic will be welcoming Ken Simpler for our next Town Hall Tuesday on March 20th!

Name: Delaware Business First Monthly Mixer
Description: Join Delaware Business First for a FREE Networking Event! Expand your network, develop relationships and grow your business in the presence of some of the best around!

Name: The English Beat
Description: The English Beat come to The Queen.

Name: Eye on Nature: Andrew Wyeth and John Ruskin
Description: Born almost exactly 100 years apart, the American painter, Andrew Wyeth (1917–2009) and the British critic and amateur artist, John Ruskin (1819–1900) shared a life-long obsession for the close observation and finely rendered imagery of the world around them. This exhibition places the work of Andrew Wyeth and John Ruskin together for the first time, examining their varying approaches to interpreting the natural world.

Name: The Drowsy Chaperone
Description: The Drowsy Chaperone is a loving send-up of the Jazz Age musical, a musical within a comedy, featuring one show-stopping number after another.

Name: Point, Counter-Point: Alan Soffer, Brian Dickerson, Moe Brooker
Description: This community-curated exhibition brings together three painters—Alan Soffer, Brian Dickerson, and Moe Brooker—who are attuned to harmonies and contrasts in abstract forms. Each artist explores the boundaries of the creative process through mixed media, color, form, and texture.

Name: Point to Point Happy Hour
Description: Point to Point Happy Hour

Name: ON ART Conversations with the Artists
Description: ON ART Conversations with the Artists features exhibiting artists, regional artists and curators. Be a part of the conversation and engage in lively discussions about current art trends and expressions...

Name: OPEN STUDIO: DRAWING and PAINTING
Description: Plan a date night with your inner artist! These informal studio sessions offer a creative community space with the guidance of a professional teaching artist. Most materials included.

Name: Tasting Room Live Music
Description: Come down to the Tasting Room every Wednesday for some live music and great beer! We've got different musicians playing every week, so stay tuned to social media for the inside scoop on who's playing when. We have some light food available from Sugarfoot Catering but also allow guests to bring their own food or order delivery to the tap room. See you all there!

Name: Sharon Sable and Shawn Qaissaunee
Description: Delight in the music of Sharon and Shawn, one of the area's most beloved jazz or pop duos.

Name: Tosca from the Royal Opera House, London
Description: Not Rated, 180 minutes Drama, passion and fabulous music - Puccini’s operatic thriller is one of the great opera experiences. Dan Ettinger conducts a star cast.

Name: 4W5 Blues Jam
Description: Come out and enjoy, or even play with the longest running Blues Jam in Wilmington!

Name: Wilmo Wednesdays
Description: Each week, Gable Music Ventures will present a curated variety show featuring live music of all genres, stand-up comedy, spoken word and slam poetry, story-telling and other forms of performance art...

Name: Oddball Bingo
Description: Every Wednesday night come on out to Oddity Bar for Oddball Bingo!

Name: Gentle Yoga, Year-Round at Winterthur
Description: Try practicing yoga in a beautiful garden setting, strengthening your body and spirit.

Name: Stages of Discovery: Bach 2 Rock: The Science of Sound
Description: Caryn Lin, electric violinist Recommended for Grades 2 - 5  Artist Website  This multi-media presentation transforms sound with a ?ve-string electric violin and a myriad of modern technology. Students journey from the classical days of Bach to today’s techno-wonders. By using modern techniques of music production to produce unique and dynamic soundscapes, students learn the scienti?c concepts and art involved in the creation of live music. Three-dimensional sound waves become visible, bringing music to life before the audience’s very eyes and ears!

Name: Homestead Collective
Description: Join us for this public concert featuring Homestead Collective, and opening act, Mariano. There will be a cash bar.

Name: Research Seminar: The Messy Work of Cleaning Up
Description: The seminar is open to the public and is based on a paper that is circulated in advance. Those planning to attend are encouraged to read the paper, “The Messy Work of Cleaning Up: Economy, Policy, and the Disposable Diaper, 1936–1996," before coming to the seminar.

Name: Salsa! Latin Thursday with DJ Bis
Description: Put your dancing shoes on and come out for a night of salsa! Whether you like Latin dancing, Latin music, or just socializing and having a great time, Celebrations on Market is the place for you every Thursday night.

Name: A Doll's House
Description: Wilmington Drama League presents a black box production of the gothic Ibsen play, A Doll’s House...

Name: Wilmington Bluegrass Festival
Description: 11th Annual INdoor Bluegrass Music Festival. Three day indoor bluegrass festival held at the Crowne Plaza Hotel. Two stages, jamming and workshops included!

Name: Glory of Stories
Description: Glory of Stories introduces young visitor to art and the Museum through a story reading followed by an interactive tour of relevant works of art and a studio art project. This program encourages learning through discovery, exploration, and hands-on experiences...

Name: Richie O
Description: Richie O joins us for Happy Hour at Harry's Savoy Grill

Name: Wicked Winter Art Show Reception
Description: Join us for the artists' reception of our annual dead of winter group art show of dark, eery, creepy, funny, and beautiful artwork in a wide variety of media. Help us say goodbye to winter, meet some artists, and see some fun art.

Name: Classics Series Concert 4
Description: DSO welcomes renowned pianist Orion Weiss for an evening of Verdi, Tchaikovsky, and Bartok...

Name: Life is a Cabaret Showcase
Description: Join the Rainbow Chorale for music from the Movies, Broadway, and our favorite Billboard Hits. Selections include a medley from Kinky Boots, the Oscar-winning Glory from the film Selma, Joyful, Joyful from Sister Act 2, Tom, Dick or Harry from Kiss me, Kate, and of course, from Cabaret, the iconic Liza Minnelli title song!

Name: Heart Under the Hoodie Adult Only Silent Party Fundraiser
Description: Join the party and help keep Heart Under the Hoodie - Christina's Youth Violence Prevention Program -- FREE for Wilmington youth!

Name: Rick Artz
Description: Rick Artz plays at Kid Shelleen's

Name: Improv 101 w/Jana Savini
Description: Improv 101 teaches basic improv scene work and performance. Is being a comedian not really your thing? This class is for you too!

Name: Easter Egg Hunt
Description: Please join the Town of Elsmere for our annual Easter Egg Hunt at Vilone Park on March 24, 2018!

Name: 4th and Rodney Easter Egg Hunt
Description: Are you looking for something fun and safe for your kids or family to do on a Saturday afternoon? Come on out and join us for our 4th and Rodney Easter Egg Hunt. There will be games, candy, and most all of lots and lots of fun

Name: Connell St. Park Easter Egg Hunt
Description: Are you looking for something fun and safe for your kids orfamily to do on a Saturday afternoon? Come on out and join us for our Connell St. Easter Egg Hunt. There will be games, candy, and most all of lots and lots of fun.

Name: Exploring the Transitions of Ashtanga Yoga with Derek McMahon
Description: Saturday March 24, 12:00-2:00pm Cost - 30 dollars

Name: Easter Bunny Express
Description: The Easter Bunny hops aboard our train for a 1½-hour round-trip ride to Ashland, and all kids will get a special treat. Bring your camera and have the Easter Bunny pose for a picture with your child. This is a great way to welcome Spring and bring the family out for an afternoon on the rails.

Name: Science Saturday – Magnetic Attraction
Description: Invisible magnetic fields can be used in so many ways. Build a magnet toy and tinker with the force! Families work together to solve science mysteries and engineering challenges.

Name: Improv 301 w/ Jana Savini
Description: Improv 301 builds on the teamwork learned in 201 to create a dynamic and unique show. Students and the instructor will choose a long form and short form games that suit their strengths and challenge them to do their best. We will apply and reinforce the basic skills of listening, support, and yes-anding, as well as refine our game playing and character building. We will learn new techniques and jump out of our comfort zone. Throughout the class, students are invited to attend Fearless Improv rehearsals for more experience.

Name: Young Ik Jang, classical guitar and Bo-Kyung Hwang, piano with special guest Benjamin Pasternak
Description: Young Ik Jang is one of the great rising stars of the guitar. Currently a doctoral student with Julian Gray at Shenandoah University, Jang recently took home second place in the prestigious Schadt String Competition (WCGS 2016-17 artist Alec Holcomb took 3rd). Join us March 24th for Jang’s program of solo works for classical guitar, as well as the first concerto we’ll have the pleasure of presenting, accompanied by pianist Bo-Kyung Hwang!

Name: Laser Spectacular featuring the music of Pink Floyd
Description: What could be more blissful than an evening of Pink Floyd’s greatest hits pumped through a 10,000 watt concert sound system? How about lasers? This 30th Anniversary production of Laser Spectacular returns to The Grand for the first time in ten years with all the elements of a live concert except the band. The show will have elaborate lighting effects, animated screen effects, and three-dimensional overhead displays created with lasers. Howard Stern exclaims that this show rocks! Price 32 dollars.

Name: Jackie Greggs
Description: Jackie Greggs plays for Harry's Savoy Grill

Name: Eggstravaganza: Breakfast and Egg Hunt
Description: Enjoy a morning at the Museum and we’ll fix a pancake breakfast for the whole family! After a wonderful meal, watch your children delight as they hunt for treat-filled eggs in our egg hunt through our gardens. Please dress accordingly for an outdoor egg hunt; it will be moved inside for rain.

Name: EGGstravaganza Breakfast and Egg Hunt
Description: Enjoy a morning at the Museum and we’ll fix a pancake breakfast for the whole family! After a wonderful meal, watch your children delight as they hunt for treat-filled eggs in our egg hunt through our gardens. Please dress accordingly for an outdoor egg hunt; it will be moved inside for rain.g

Name: Animal Enrichment Workshop
Description: Craft-loving individuals will enjoy this hands-on workshop making enrichment for our Zoo animals. Learn all about the different kinds of enrichment we use to engage our animals’ minds at Brandywine Zoo, help us craft and create new items, and see some of your hard work given out around the Zoo! You’ll also be able to make some awesome enrichment to bring back to your pets at home! This month's animal:Bobcat!

Name: Community Easter Egg Hunt
Description: Our annual community Easter Egg Hunt takes place immediately following our 10:30 service (@ 11:40 am). We will gather outside by the playground. Children of all ages are invited to attend. Bring your own basket; we will have extra bags available for those who forget. Simple snacks will be provided. The Easter Bunny will be making an appearance. In the event of inclement weather, the egg hunt will take place at 12:15 pm on Easter Sunday.

Name: Sunday Jazz or Gospel Brunch
Description: Brunch is available from 12:00pm until 3pm. Ala carte dining is offered from 3pm on. Enjoy live Jazz and Gospel from 1pm til 4pm

Name: Jay Ungar and Molly Mason
Description: Fiddle-guitarist duo, Jay Ungar and Molly Mason, husband-and-wife perennial favorites, are back to charm listeners with their exceptional musicianship and comfortable rapport with the audience. Explorers into the breadth of traditional American music, the duo have performed on CBS’s Good Morning, NPR’s All Things Considered, and have been regular guests on Prairie Home Companion. Jay’s haunting Ashokan Farewell was acclaimed as the main musical theme in the Ken Burns Civil War docu-series on PBS. Garrison Keillor says that “Jay and Molly make music that is simple and overwhelming. Joyful and full of feeling. Price 33 dollars.

Name: Speaker John W. Snell Developing Your Creative Vision
Description: John shares stories and practical techniques and tips for enhancing your landscape and nature photography. There won’t be talk about equipment you should have, but rather how to make stellar images with the equipment you already have.  John’s Award-winning work is characterized by saturated colors and he represents his subjects in ways that evoke smiles of wonder.

Name: Zoo IN You
Description: Trillions of microbes make their homes inside our bodies, and we wouldn’t be able to survive without each other!

Name: The 2018 Young Brandywine Artists Exhibition
Description: The Young Brandywine Artists Exhibition features outstanding artwork created by students in all schools within the Brandywine School District, from elementary through high school.

Name: Eye Shadow Art Exhibit
Description: Eye Shadow a Bebe Ross Coker BrainChild is an exploration of lived themes from a woman's perspective. Subjects include nature, self-development, feminism, motherhood, health and wellness, spirituality, friendship, community, social justice and more

Name: DCH Art Gallery Show: Inner Light by Terence Roberts
Description: DCH's Art Gallery Show featuring Inner Light by Terence Roberts

Name: Photos with The Easter Bunny
Description: The Easter Bunny is back, so hop into Concord Mall to celebrate the spring season! Pose for your holiday photos and create lasting family memories.

Name: Group Show Ed Bronstein, Sherrill Cooper, Barbara Straussberg
Description: Our March show features landscapes, city scenes and still lifes by Ed Bronstein; gestural figure paintings in oil by Sherrill Cooper, and abstract mixed media work by Barbara Straussberg. Wine and Cheese Opening Reception.

Name: Form to Function I and II Gregory Nangle and Peter Pincus
Description: The Delaware Contemporary collaboration with Philadelphia's Wexler Gallery returns for a second time to spotlight two visionary artists Gregory Nangle and Peter Pincus...

Name: The Art Of Ken Segal
Description: Stop by ArtzScape on Market Street during the March Art Loop for a chance to get up close and personal with Delaware artist Ken Segal.

Name: Kids eat free night with Jungle John
Description: Join us each week for a great family night at Kid Shelleen's!

Name: Sarah McBride, Author Talk with Ashley Biden!
Description: Sarah McBride, LGBT rights activist and author of Tomorrow Will Be Different: Love, Loss, and the Fight for Trans Equality will speak with Ashley Biden about her newly published book...

Name: Silk and Honey
Description: Come buzz with us every other Monday as AJ and Joanna bring the smooth, sweet melodies to the Tap House!

Name: Masha Ryskin's Reveries with the Line
Description: Ryskin uses unique materials such as tea bags, recycled fabric, or coffee to record fragments of life and experience in her installations, drawings, paintings, and prints. Art critic Arthur Whitman refers to Ryskin's work as experimental, that which crosses media and genre with an exploratory but disciplined sensibility.

Name: The Nature of Color: John Breakey and Scott Alan McClurg
Description: By looking up and out, I am inspired to capture nature’s elusive luminosity found in the near and far distance. Slowing down to observe becomes a pure investment that supports a call to action. These atmospheric impressions are the result of simple pause and response acts.

Name: Half-Price Burger Day
Description: Tuesday is half-price burger day at Kid's!  Enjoy your favorites when you dine with us for lunch or dinner.  Taking out?  Enjoy 25% off your takeout burgers, too! Find out why Kid's has been named Delaware's Best Burger for 5 years running!

Name: Collecting for The Future
Description: When Winterthur opened to the public in 1951, visitors toured a private collection assembled over several decades by Henry Francis du Pont (1880-1969). He dreamed that his collection and 175-room home would “afford all those interested an opportunity to view and to study the conditions surrounding the early American home life.
